reg_info.act_under: Livestock and Livestock Products Act   Loi sur le bétail et les produits du bétail

content.content: 1. In this Regulation, “non-ambulatory” means unable to stand without assistance or to move without being dragged or carried. O. Reg. 732/94, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. In this Regulation,

“non-ambulatory” means unable to stand without assistance or to move without being dragged or carried. O. Reg. 732/94, s. 1.

content.content: 2. Goats, horses for slaughter, sheep, wild swine, domestic swine, ratites, deer, elk and bison that are non-ambulatory are designated as livestock. O. Reg. 732/94, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 2. Goats, horses for slaughter, sheep, wild swine, domestic swine, ratites, deer, elk and bison that are non-ambulatory are designated as livestock. O. Reg. 732/94, s. 2.

content.content: 3. Dealers who deal in goats, horses for slaughter, sheep, wild swine, domestic swine, ratites, deer, elk or bison are exempt from section 2 of the Act. O. Reg. 732/94, s. 3.
content.raw_html: 3. Dealers who deal in goats, horses for slaughter, sheep, wild swine, domestic swine, ratites, deer, elk or bison are exempt from section 2 of the Act. O. Reg. 732/94, s. 3.

content.content: 4. No person shall load, unload or transfer non-ambulatory cattle, goats, horses for slaughter, sheep, wild swine, domestic swine, ratites, deer, elk or bison in a manner that, (a) drags them in direct contact with the ground; or (b) pulls them by the head, horns, neck, feet or tail. O. Reg. 732/94, s. 4.
content.raw_html:
4. No person shall load, unload or transfer non-ambulatory cattle, goats, horses for slaughter, sheep, wild swine, domestic swine, ratites, deer, elk or bison in a manner that,

(a) drags them in direct contact with the ground; or

(b) pulls them by the head, horns, neck, feet or tail. O. Reg. 732/94, s. 4.

content.content: 5. No person shall move non-ambulatory cattle, goats, horses for slaughter, sheep, wild swine, domestic swine, ratites, deer, elk or bison unless, (a) they are accompanied by a certificate for direct transport to slaughter issued by a veterinarian; and (b) they are physically separated from other animals in the vehicle. O. Reg. 732/94, s. 5.
content.raw_html:
5. No person shall move non-ambulatory cattle, goats, horses for slaughter, sheep, wild swine, domestic swine, ratites, deer, elk or bison unless,

(a) they are accompanied by a certificate for direct transport to slaughter issued by a veterinarian; and

(b) they are physically separated from other animals in the vehicle. O. Reg. 732/94, s. 5.

content.content: 6. If cattle, goats, horses for slaughter, sheep, wild swine, domestic swine, ratites, deer, elk and bison become non-ambulatory during transport, the operator of the vehicle transporting them shall arrange for them to be examined by a veterinarian licensed under the Veterinarians Act and then transport them to a slaughter plant within the meaning of Ontario Regulation 31/05 (Meat) made under the Food Safety and Quality Act, 2001 operated by a licensee under that regulation or to a registered establishment within the meaning of the Meat Inspection Act (Canada). O. Reg. 732/94, s. 6; O. Reg. 226/05, s. 1.
